newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Zalakeramia drops to adjust to issue price.
newsitem.headline: Zalakeramia drops to adjust to issue price.

text.p: Tile maker Zalakeramia shares have begun to recover on the Budapest bourse from steep early losses triggered by the fact that its price was adjusting to the issue price in a private placement, traders said.
"Zalakeramia was falling because of the (lower) issue price but investors have begun to buy so I don't think that would be a long-lasting fall," one trader said.
At 1003 GMT Zalakeramia traded at 7,200 forints, down 495 from Wednesday's close but above the lowest level up to that time on Thursday of 7,000 forints.
Zalakeramia raised its 1.836 billion forints share capital by 1.04 billion via a private placement to finance acquisitions and expansion plans.
Trading sources said earlier this week that Zalakeramia placed the Global Depositary Receipts (GDRs) - with five GDRs representing one share - at $7.67.
On the SEAQ Zalakeramia was marked at $7.45 at 1000 GMT.
